docs.snippet: In a part of the world where such institutions have become almost non-existent, Venezuela through fifteen difficult years has maintained a democratic system and an open society. In 1968, the system met one of the most difficult tests of all: peaceful...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a part of the world where such institutions have become almost non-existent, Venezuela through fifteen difficult years has maintained a democratic system and an open society. In 1968, the system met one of the most difficult tests of all: peaceful transfer of power after the Social Christian party (COPEI) narrowly upset Democratic Action (A.D.), the base from which Romulo Betancourt restored democracy to Venezuela in 1958.
docs.abstract: ed says that L Fernandez and C Andres Perez, leading candidates to succeed Venezuelan Pres R Caldera, have similar views on development of nation's oil indus and differ principally on uses to which increased oil revenues should be put in furthering country's economic and soc progress; says whoever is elected will be under heavy pressure in time of worldwide energy shortages to assume greater control over resource that provides 2/3s of Govt income

headline.main: Foreign Exchange; Market Averages LONDON METAL MARKET

docs.snippet: A spokesman for the all-black ad hoc committee on the Sugar Bowl announced today that street demonstrations would be staged next week to protest what is called the "Racist" policies of the organization operating the annual football game. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the all-black ad hoc committee on the Sugar Bowl announced today that street demonstrations would be staged next week to protest what is called the "Racist" policies of the organization operating the annual football game. The committee also is trying to block the broadcast of the game between Alabama and Notre Dame.
docs.abstract: spokesman for all-black ad hoc com on Sugar Bowl announces on Dec 14 that street demonstrations will be staged next wk to protest what is called 'racist' policies of New Orleans Mid-Winter Sports Assn, organization that sponsors Sugar Bowl; com is also attempting to block broadcast of game between Notre Dame and Alabama Univ

headline.main: Sports News Briefs; Sugar Bowl Demonstrations Planned South Africa Leads in Cup Tennis Snow Threatens Cup Ski Race College Title to Be Decided Today Blatchford 2d in Speed Skating

docs.snippet: Amnesty International, the organization dedicated to assisting political prisoners, has charged that torture as a systematic weapon of control is being used by almost half the world's governments and is spreading rapidly.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amnesty International, the organization dedicated to assisting political prisoners, has charged that torture as a systematic weapon of control is being used by almost half the world's governments and is spreading rapidly.
docs.abstract: Amnesty Internatl, during wk of Dec 9, holds conf in Paris during which speakers charge that torture as a systematic weapon of control is being used by almost half world's govts and is spreading rapidly; issues rept 'documenting' evidence 64 nations, democracies as well as police states, use torture for pol ends; statement by Turkish leftist activist A S Eker cited; Amnesty chmn S MacBride comments; delegates at conf include former US Atty Gen R Clark, Lord Caradon and D Dolci

headline.main: 64 Nations Charged in Report as Users of Torture; U.S. Is Cited Turk Describes Torture Publicity Is Weapon Military Gets Blame

docs.snippet: Frew McMilIan and Bob Hewitt trounced Tom Koch and Edison Mandarino, 6-0, 6-0, 6-1, today to give South Africa an insurmountable lead over Brazil in a South American Zone Davis Cup tennis pairing.

docs.snippet: William J. McIntosh, a retired chemical consultant, died at Stamford Hospital yesterday. He was 80 years old and lived at Westover Park. Mr. McIntosh was a Fellow Emeritus of the Institute of Chemists and the American Chemical Society.
docs.lead_paragraph: William J. McIntosh, a retired chemical consultant, died at Stamford Hospital yesterday. He was 80 years old and lived at Westover Park. Mr. McIntosh was a Fellow Emeritus of the Institute of Chemists and the American Chemical Society.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Delegates to the 28th General Assembly headed home this week after a 13-week session in which they adopted 150 resolutions and wrote a new international treaty that aims at protecting diplomats from attack.
docs.lead_paragraph: Delegates to the 28th General Assembly headed home this week after a 13-week session in which they adopted 150 resolutions and wrote a new international treaty that aims at protecting diplomats from attack.
docs.abstract: US delegate to UN W T Bennett Jr on Dec 22 denounces killings on Dec 17 at Rome and Athens airports by Palestinian hijackers, speech at end of General Assembly session; Assembly agrees on recess, instead of adjournment, so that delegates could be summoned back quickly if Middle East developments warranted; Oct Arab-Israeli war preoccupied diplomats in Assembly although measures to end conflict were handled by Security Council; Assembly did approve $30-million budget for 6 mos of operation of UN peace force now stationed between Egyptian and Israeli forces

headline.main: U.N. Assembly Session Produces 150 Resolutions and a Treaty to Protect Diplomats; Terrorism Not Debated Recess Instead of Adjourn To Be Held In 1975 U.S. Abstains on Vote

docs.snippet: In the late stages of World War II, Thomas K. Finletter drew on his considerable Washington experience to write a thoughtful book, "Can Representative Government Do the Job?" An appropriate question for that uncertain period, it is even more...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the late stages of World War II, Thomas K. Finletter drew on his considerable Washington experience to write a thoughtful book, "Can Representative Government Do the Job?" An appropriate question for that uncertain period, it is even more pertinent today.
docs.abstract: Ed on worldwide pol developments in '73 suggesting repr democracy is in trouble almost everywhere; says US, in wake of Watergate affair, offers abundant evidence of eroding public confidence, not merely in Nixon Adm, but in public insts as well

docs.snippet: Six members of a family from Winnipeg, Canada, were. killed last night when their twin-engine plane crashed 300 feet from a farm home shortly after take-off from the Bismarck Airport, the authorities said.
